channel.title: AutoFS on Tech Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in AutoFS on Tech Notebook

item.title: Amazon S3: Clean and Automated Backups with Amazon S3
item.description:
Introduction link

For those who don’t know, Amazon S3 is a remote backup service. The advantages are:

  • the price
  • the bandwidth
  • the storage

I’ll let you look at the price list to see for yourself.

item.title: AutoFS: Mounting and Unmounting Shares
item.description:
Introduction link

You already installed Linux on your networked desktop PC and now you want to work with files stored on some other PCs in your network. This is where autofs comes into play. This tutorial shows how to configure autofs to use CIFS to access Windows or Samba shares from Linux Desktop PCs. It also includes a tailored configuration file.

If autofs Version 4.0 or newer is already installed, you should find these files:
